intro: Restio incurvatus, commonly known as the bent reed, is a species of restio native to southern Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Restionaceae, characterized by its grass-like appearance and dense, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, hollow stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dune ecosystems. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing dune systems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
